servinfo.title: DTC P1685: CAN Communication (Reception Error for ABS or ESP® Control Module)

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P1674: CAN Communication (Bus Off Error) .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Reception error of communication data for ABS or ESP® control module is detected for longer than specified time continuously.

s1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC by using scan tool.
Start engine and run it for 1 min. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 2.
Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: DTC check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM, TCM (for A/T model), ABS / ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped), keyless start control module (if equipped) and BCM for DTC.

testgroup.question: Is there any DTC(s) other than CAN communication DTC(s) at each control module (other than DTC P1618, P1674, P1676, P1678, P1685 in ECM, DTC P1774, P1777, P1778 in TCM (for A/T model), DTC U1073, U1100, U1101, U1121, U1126, U1139, U1140, U1144 in BCM, ABS / ESP® control module and 4WD control module (if equipped), and DTC No.31 / 33 in keyless start control module (if equipped))?

action.ptxt: Go to applicable DTC diag. flow.
Go to Step 3.

testgroup.title: Check CAN communication error for ECM

test1.ptxt: Check ECM for DTC.

testgroup.question: Is there DTC P1674?

action.ptxt: Go to DTC P1674: CAN Communication (Bus Off Error) .
Go to Step 4.

testgroup.title: ECM and ABS / ESP® control module connector check

test1.ptxt: Check for proper connection at each ECM and ABS / ESP® control module connector terminals with ignition switch turned OFF.
If connections are OK, recheck ECM for DTC with engine running.

testgroup.question: Is there DTC P1685?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 5.
Intermittent trouble. Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.title: ECM power and ground circuit check

test1.ptxt: Check ECM power and ground circuits referring to ECM Power and Ground Circuit Check .

testgroup.question: Are they in good condition?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 6.
Repair ECM power and/or ground circuits.

testgroup.title: DTC check in ABS / ESP® control module

test1.ptxt: Check DTC U1073 in ABS / ESP® control module.

testgroup.question: Is it indicated?

item.ptxt: For vehicle without ESP®, go to DTC U1073: Control Module Communication Bus Off .
For vehicle with ESP®, go to DTC U1073: Control Module Communication Bus Off .

action.ptxt: Go to Step 7.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ABS or ESP® control module and ECM.
Check that CAN communication circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: Circuit resistance of CAN communication circuit is less than 1 Ω between “WHT/RED” terminal of ECM connector and “WHT/RED” terminal of ABS or ESP® connector.
Circuit resistance of CAN communication circuit is less than 1 Ω between “WHT/BLU” terminal of ECM connector and “WHT/BLU” terminal of ABS / ESP® control module connector.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 8.

test1.ptxt: Connect connector to ABS or ESP® control module with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance at following connector terminals.

item.ptxt: Between “WHT/BLU” and “WHT” terminals of ABS or ESP® control module connector.
Between “WHT/RED” and “RED” terminals of ABS or ESP® control module connector.

action.ptxt: CAN communication circuit wire between ABS or ESP® control module and ECM connector is open or high resistance.
Substitute a known-good ABS or ESP® control module assembly and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Connect connectors to ABS or ESP® control module and ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Disconnect connector from BCM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC(s).

action.ptxt: Go to Step 8.

CAN communication circuit wire between BCM and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check BCM power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good BCM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from TCM (for A/T model) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 9.

CAN communication circuit wire between TCM and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check TCM power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good TCM (for A/T model) and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from keyless start control module (if equipped) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 10.

CAN communication circuit wire between keyless start control module and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check keyless start control module power and ground circuit. If circuit are OK, substitute a known-good keyless start control module and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from combination meter with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 11.

CAN communication circuit wire between combination meter and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check combination meter power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good combination meter and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from 4WD control module (if equipped) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 12.

CAN communication circuit wire between 4WD control module and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check 4WD control module power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good 4WD control module and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from steering angle sensor (vehicle with ESP®) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 15.

CAN communication circuit wire between steering angle sensor and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check steering angle sensor power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good steering angle sensor and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from all control modules (ECM, TCM (if equipped), BCM, ABS or ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped), keyless start control module (if equipped), combination meter, steering to angle sensor (vehicle with ESP®) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check that CAN communication circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: All wire harness resistance of CAN communication circuit is less than 1 Ω between each control module.
Insulation resistance between CAN communication circuit wires is infinity at each control module connector.
Insulation resistance between each CAN communication circuit wire and vehicle body ground is infinity at each control module connector.
Circuit voltage of CAN communication circuit is 0 V with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 16.
Repair or replace defective CAN communication circuit.

testgroup.title: ABS warning lamp check

test1.ptxt: Connect connectors to all control modules communicating by CAN.
Turn ignition switch ON.

testgroup.question: Is ABS warning lamp light up?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ABS or ESP® control module and recheck.
Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
